dame noun [C]
(WOMAN)

US old-fashioned slang a woman
dame noun [C]
(CHARACTER)
UK the funny character of an older woman, usually played by a man, in a pantomime (= a musical play for children)

a title used in front of a woman's name that is given in Britain as a special honour, usually for valuable work done over a long period, or a woman having this honour: Dame Judy Dench Compare
